ast.name: Number Puzzle
ast.comment: Now able to determine the "Impossible to Solve" situation based on what I read at http://mathworld.wolfram.com/15Puzzle.html

body.text: Set the no. of tiles and colour
Sprite showing the number is slightly smaller than actual cell, so the box and borders are visible clearly
Setup 2 sprites; one for the tile and one for the number

elseBody.text: Find a random empty space, so it can be ignored while setting the numbers
Loop through and set the numbers

body.text: Setup 2 sprites; one for the tile and one for the number
If this is the randomly chosen empty cell then just store 0 in the number map, otherwise generate and store random numbers

elseBody.text: Finally, always the last number will be the last number in the series, that's not good shuffle, so another small workaround...

body.text: Setup the reference number map which can be used to check if the game is over...
Check if this is valid move...
Convert the number map to string...
Check if the game is over...
